class lib.core.jobref.AbstractJobRef(id, create_time, status, owner)[source]¶

AbstractJobRef is an abstract class that describes the common interface of JobRef and WorkflowRef

@author: Bertrand Néron @contact: bneron@pasteur.fr @organization: Institut Pasteur @license: GPLv3

class lib.core.status.Status(code, message='')[source]¶

reflect the different steps of a job life

BUILDING = 10¶

the job has been submitted to the execution system to be running

ERROR = 60¶

the job was stopped by an administrator or the user

FINISHED = 50¶

un error occurred the job is stopped

KILLED = 70¶

the job is hold by the execution system

PENDING = 30¶

the job is running

RUNNING = 40¶

the job is completed without error

SUBMITTED = 20¶

the job is pending in the execution system note that some system cannot pend a job (SYS)

UNKNOWN = 0¶

the environment of the job is building (working directory creation, building command line, ...)

__eq__(other)[source]¶

two Status instance are equals if there code and message are equals

__init__(code, message='')[source]¶
Parameters:
  • code (integer) – the code of the status
  • string (string) – the code of the status representing by a string
  • message (string) – the message associated to the status
__ne__(other)[source]¶

two Status instance are not equals if they are different code or message

__str__()[source]¶

sring representaion of a Status instance

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

is_ended()[source]¶
Returns:True if the status is among the following ones :
  • 4 : “finished”, the job is finished without error from Mobyle
  • 5 : “error”, the job has failed due to a MobyleError
  • 6 : “killed”, the job has been removed by the user, or killed by the admin
Return type:boolean
is_known()[source]¶

if the system know the status of the job

Return type:boolean
is_on_error()[source]¶
Returns:True if the status is among the following ones :
  • 5 : “error”, the job has failed due to a MobyleError
  • 6 : “killed”, the job has been removed by the user, or killed by the admin
Return type:boolean
is_queryable()[source]¶
Returns:True if the status is among the following ones :
  • 1 : “submitted”, the job.run method has been called
  • 2 : “pending”, the job has been submitted to the batch manager but wait for a slot
  • 3 : “running”, the job is running in the batch manager
  • 7 : “hold”, the job is hold by the batch manager
Return type:boolean
is_submittable()[source]¶
Returns:True if the job is ready to be submitted to a batch system :
Return type:boolean

@author: Bertrand Néron @contact: bneron@pasteur.fr @organization: Institut Pasteur @license: GPLv3

class lib.execution_engine.db_manager.DBManager(jobs_table, master_q)[source]¶

synchronize the data base with the job in the system * get new entry in database and put the corresponding job in the JobsTable * update the status of running job from the system in the database * remove the completed jobs from the jobsTable

__init__(jobs_table, master_q)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • jobs_table (L{JobsTable} instance) – the container shared by all containing all L{JobRef} alive in the system
  • master_q (L{multiprocessing.Queue} instance) – a communication queue to listen comunication emit by the L{Master} instance
get_new_jobs(conn)[source]¶

get the new job entries in the db and fill the jobs_table with the corresponding job

Parameters:conn – a connection to the database
update_jobs(conn, jobs_to_update)[source]¶

synchronize the db with the jobs from the jobs_table and remove completed jobs from the jobs table

Parameters:
  • conn – a connection to the database
  • jobs_to_update (list of L{JobRef}) – the jobs to update

Created on Aug 13, 2012

@author: Bertrand Néron @contact: bneron@pasteur.fr @organization: Institut Pasteur @license: GPLv3

class lib.execution_engine.jobstable.JobsTable[source]¶
maintain the list of active jobs. There is one jobsTable instance which is shared by the other processes
  • the L{DBmanager} instance,
  • the L{jtMonitor} instance,
  • the L{SubmitActor} instances,
  • the L{StatusActor} instances,
  • the L{NotificationActor} instances
__init__()[source]¶

Constructor

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

get(job_id)[source]¶

@param job_id: the id of a jobRef @type job_id: string @return: the jobRef corresponding to the jobid without remove it from the table. @rtype: L{JobRef} instance

jobs()[source]¶

@return: the list of L{jobRef} contained in the table, sort by the increasing jobRef timestamp @rtype: list of L{JobRef}

pop(job_id)[source]¶

@param job_id: the id of a JobRef instance @type job_id: string @return: and remove the JobRef instance corresponding to job_id from the table. @rtype: L{JobRef}

put(job_ref)[source]¶

add a JobRef instance in table

Parameters:job_ref (L{JobRef} instance) – the JobRef instance to add in the table
class lib.execution_engine.monitor.JtMonitor(jobs_table, master_q)[source]¶

The JtMonitor monitor the jobs table and for each job start a new actor according the job status.

__init__(jobs_table, master_q)[source]¶

@param jobs_table: the container shared by all containing all L{JobRef} alive in the system @type jobs_table: L{JobsTable} instance @param master_q: a communication queue to listen comunication emit by the L{Master} instance @type master_q: L{multiprocessing.Queue} instance

wait for children completion before exiting
